     <!-- com.omniupdate.div label="maincontent" group="Everyone" button="707" -->
     <!-- ouc:editor csspath="/z-omniupdate/css/style.css" cssmenu="/z-omniupdate/css/style.txt" width="700"/ -->
     <object width="700" height="165" data="/flash/slidesho.swf" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"><param name="data" value="/flash/slidesho.swf"></param><param name="src" value="/flash/slidesho.swf"></param></object> 
     <div style="float: none;"> 
      <ul class="texttab-control"> 
       <li><a onfocus="if(this.blur)this.blur()" href="#news">News</a></li> 
       <li><a onfocus="if(this.blur)this.blur()" href="#programs">Other Programs</a></li> 
       <!--<li><a onfocus="if(this.blur)this.blur()" href="#other">Other Links</a></li>--> 
       <li><a onfocus="if(this.blur)this.blur()" href="#careers">Career Opportunities</a></li> 
       <li><a onfocus="if(this.blur)this.blur()" href="#gri">UCR's Graduation Rate Initiative</a></li> 
      </ul> 
     </div> 
     <div id="programs"> 
      <div class="texttab-column"> 
       <div class="tab_content"> 
        <ul> 
         <li> <h5><strong><a href="/honors/convocation.html">Honors Convocation</a></strong></h5> Honors Convocation is an awards ceremony that recognizes high-achieving students in University Honors.</li> 
         <li> <h5><a href="#"><strong>Student Success</strong></a></h5> Student Success houses a variety of initiatives and activities. It provides support for the First Year Learning Communities, the ARC Supplemental Instruction and Early Warning Programs, the research activities within the Undergraduate Research in the Community Program, the Undergraduate Research Symposium and the Undergraduate Research Journal, and has contributed to UE’s success in receiving outside grant support with the subsequent grant management for the several campus programs (e.g., STEM Pathway CCRAA grant, CHASS Connect Evaluation FIPSE grant, and California Campus Compact Students In Service grant).</li> 
         <li> <h5><strong><a href="http://wasc.ucr.edu/">WASC Re-accreditation</a></strong></h5> WASC Re-accreditation provides a range of support services intended to maximize UCR students' competitiveness for prestigious awards. The office works with students at all academic levels to create effective strategies for securing scholarships, fellowships, and awards.</li> 
        </ul> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
     <!--<div id="other">
<div class="texttab-column">
<div class="tab_content">
<ul>
<li>
<h5><strong><a href="#">Innovative Teaching Awards</a></strong></h5>
The Innovative Teaching Award is presented to faculty who demonstrate exceptional effort and achievement in teaching innovation. Nominations are submitted to the Academy of Distinguished Teachers, who are charged with selecting one or two teachers to honor each year.
<p>&nbsp;</p>
</li>
<li>
<h5><strong><a href="http://iteach.ucr.edu/">iTeach</a></strong></h5>
iTeach provides instructional tools, techniques, and services to faculty and instructors whether they are teaching for the first time or 1000th.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>--> 
     <div id="news"> 
      <div class="texttab-column"> 
       <div class="tab_content"> 
        <ul>
         <li><h5><strong><a href="/news/archived_news.html#news_1">Internships with Greater Riverside Community Organizations </a></strong></h5><h6>February 24, 2014 </h6><br /><p> <img src="/images/comm_foundation_logo.png" alt="" /><br /><br />The Office of Undergraduate Education (UE) is pleased to announce a pilot internship program with community organizations in the greater Riverside area. <br /><br /> Interns will be matched by the Community Foundation Serving Riverside and San Bernardino Counties with organizations requiring their skills <em><strong>for up to 10 hours per week</strong></em>. The goal of this program is to show that well-qualified UCR students can and will add value to the work of community organizations. For students, this can be an opportunity to hone skills and to gain valuable work experience, perhaps even to make contacts that will lead to jobs. Opportunities to gain credit for internship experiences are available in your major academic departments through 198I courses. UE will help facilitate 198I enrollments for course credit. <br /><br /> In spring term UE will recruit and select several students for this pilot effort. The Community Foundation will provide matches to students' skills and experience. To apply, please <a class="button2" href="https://ueucr.wufoo.com/forms/qsdtwf51c06r4k/">fill out the application form</a> . <br /><br /> We will begin reviewing applications on March 1. You will be notified by March 15 if you have been selected for one of the internships. Internships will begin at the beginning of spring term. </p></li>
         <div class="clear"></div>
         <li><h5><strong><a href="/news/archived_news.html#news_2">Student Initiated R' Courses - Call for Proposals </a></strong></h5><h6>February 24, 2014 </h6><a href="/images/news/preview/rcourse_full.png"><img class="figure_R" src="/images/news/preview/rcourse_preview.png" alt="news preview for item 2" /></a><br /><p> The Academic Senate recently approved the offering of student-initiated courses, also known as R' Courses.&nbsp; For Spring Quarter 2014, the Office of Undergraduate Education hopes to work with motivated students to pilot one or two R'Courses.&nbsp; In Academic Year 2014-15, R'Courses will be officially launched with the Call for Proposals available in Fall, student facilitator training in Winter, and R'Courses offered in Spring. <br /><br /> View the&nbsp;<a href="/news/rcourse_announcement_2014.docx">Call for Proposals</a>&nbsp;and fill out the &nbsp;<a href="/news/rcourse_proposal_2014.docx">Proposal Form</a>.&nbsp; Proposals are due on&nbsp;<span data-term="goog_1610223536">Friday, March 14, 2014</span> <br /><br /> For more information or sample courses and syllabi, please contact Elizabeth Claassen Thrush, Coordinator of Educational Initiatives (Email:&nbsp;<a href="mailto:elizabeth.thrush@ucr.edu" target="_blank">elizabeth.thrush@ucr.edu</a>, Phone:&nbsp;<a href="tel:951-827-7739" target="_blank">951-827-7739</a>). </p></li>
         <div class="clear"></div>
         <li><h5><strong><a href="/news/archived_news.html#news_3">UC Riverside's First Family Endows New Chancellor's Research Fellowship to Support Undergraduate Research </a></strong></h5><h6>February 19, 2014 </h6><a href="/images/news/preview/chancellorwilcox_full.png"><img class="figure_R" src="/images/news/preview/chancellorwilcox_preview.png" alt="news preview for item 3" /></a><br /><p> It is our pleasure to announce that Chancellor Kim A. Wilcox and his wife Diane Del Buono will endow a new Chancellor's Research Fellow with a personal gift of $100,000. This will be the 13th research fellowship providing financial support to undergraduate scholars at UCR. Inaugurated in 2012, the fellowship is an annual competition designed to encourage faculty-mentored research and creative activity among our undergraduate student population. Fellowship recipients are awarded grants up to $5,000 to help pay for research expenses. <br /><br /> For additional information regarding our Fellows or the Call for Applications, please visit our <a href="/ugr.ucr.edu/chancellor_fellowship/">webpage</a>. </p></li>
         <div class="clear"></div>
         <li><h5><strong><a href="/news/archived_news.html#news_4">The face of YOUR classroom is diverse - Winter Scholarship of Teaching and Learning Colloquium on Tuesday, February 25th at Noon, HUB 268 </a></strong></h5><h6>February 14, 2014 </h6><a href="/images/news/preview/hyman_full.png"><img class="figure_R" src="/images/news/preview/hyman_preview.png" alt="news preview for item 4" /></a><br /><p> </p><h5 style="margin-top: 0.5;">The face of YOUR classroom is diverse</h5> <br /><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Presented by Dr. Bradley Hyman<br /></strong><br /><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Professor and Chair, Department of Biology<br /></strong><br /><strong>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;Director, CalTEACH Science/Mathematics Initiative</strong><br /> <br /><strong> Tuesday, February 25th at Noon, HUB 268</strong><br /><br /><br /> <p></p></li>
         <div class="clear"></div>
         <li><a href="/news/archived_news.html">Archived News</a></li> 
        </ul> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
     <div id="careers"> 
      <div class="texttab-column"> 
       <div class="tab_content">
        &nbsp;
       </div> 
       <ul class="standout">
        <!--<li>All UE positions have been filled.</li>--> 
        <li> <h5><strong>Assistant Director, University Honors Program</strong></h5> 
         <div class="xpander"> 
          <p>The Assistant Director of Student Affairs manages the student affairs components of University Honors. This includes oversight of recruitment efforts; orientation and transition; requirements for completion; student success and personal growth programming; peer mentor training and leadership; and campus service and civic engagement; thesis development and completion; and professional development including encouraging student involvement in undergraduate research. This individual serves as a recognized resource of high-achieving undergraduate student success programs, especially with a student population that has great diversity and high numbers of low income and first generation students. The Assistant Director supervises two Student Development Coordinators (SAOIII). The Assistant Director of Student Affairs serves with general direction from, and reports to, the University Honors Director.</p> 
          <p>University Honors is a four year program that selects high achieving participants from the incoming first year students. Additionally, the program provides entry portals for 2nd, 3rd, 4th and Transfer populations. The enrollment of the University Honors community remains between 4-5% of the undergraduate student population.</p> 
          <br /> 
          <a title="Link to University of California Riverside posting" href="https://irecruitportal.ucr.edu/irecruit/!Controller?action=jobs_webui.show_page&amp;page=jobs_detail&amp;requisition_id=201307109888&amp;profile_id=&amp;module=jobs">Visit the UCR HR Jobs posting to apply </a>
         </div> </li> 
        <li> <h5><strong>Assistant Director for Academic Partnership Program, Academic Resource Center<br /></strong></h5> 
         <div class="xpander"> 
          <p>Academic Resource Center<br /> Student Affairs Officer 4, Supervisor; Title Code 4357<br /> Annual Salary Range: $48,678 - $74,144 <br /><br /> UCR’s ACADEMIC RESOURCE CENTER invites qualified applicants to apply for an exciting career opportunity with the Office of Undergraduate Education's Academic Resource Center. <br /><br /> The Academic Resource Centers Assistant Director for Academic Partnership Programs manages overall coordination and operation of the Academic Partnership Programs unit, which specializes in academic support programs that are driven by partnerships with faculty and academic units to facilitate student success. The Assistant Director provides leadership, planning and supervision for the following campus-wide programs: Early Assist, Summer Bridge, Math Preparation Programs (Math Advisory Exam and Intermediate Algebra Workshop), Upper Division and Graduate Student Support Programs (Standardized Examination Preparation Workshops), and Writing Support Programs. The incumbent directly supervises 3-4 FTE staff (Level 2 &amp; 3 Student Affairs Officer and Student Affairs Officer Supervisors) and indirectly supervises 10-12 full-time, contract, and part-time employees; managing an annual operating budget of approximately $1M. The Assistant Director may represent the Director in meetings with faculty, administration, and student leadership. The Assistant Director reports to the Director of the Academic Resource Center. <br /><br /> The successful candidate will have a Master’s Degree and 5+ years demonstrated experience in increasingly responsible positions in higher education. Demonstrated management experience, including: 1) ability to recruit, train, supervise, assign and delegate workflow, and evaluate full time and student staff; and 2) demonstrated success in managing budgets of similar size. The successful candidate will also have: a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain open and effective working relationships with students, staff, faculty, and friends of the University; a record of leadership with a focus on collaboration; a commitment to working in a multicultural community; and a strong work ethic focusing on student success. Successful performance in an on-campus interview is also required. For a list of minimum requirements a preferred qualifications and additional information please visit the <a href="https://irecruitportal.ucr.edu/irecruit/!Controller?action=jobs_webui.show_page&amp;page=jobs_detail&amp;requisition_id=201402114263&amp;profile_id=&amp;module=jobs">UCR Job Site</a>. <br /><br /> The UCR Academic Resource Center provides student academic support programs and services including supplemental instruction, tutoring assistance, peer mentorship, study skills instruction, early assist, math placement and instruction, summer bridge, and intervention programs for all students, including students at-risk or in academic difficulty. The department has 20 FTE professional staff and over 200 part-time student employees annually. <br /><br /> Position open until filled. To apply for this position please visit <a href="https://irecruitportal.ucr.edu/irecruit/!Controller?action=jobs_webui.show_page&amp;page=jobs_detail&amp;requisition_id=201402114263&amp;profile_id=&amp;module=jobs">JOBS AT UCR</a>.</p> 
         </div> </li> 
       </ul> 
       <ul> 
        <li> <p>To view all open positions at UCR, visit <a class="button2" href="http://jobs.ucr.edu/">jobs.ucr.edu</a></p> </li> 
       </ul> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
     <div id="gri"> 
      <div class="texttab-column"> 
       <div class="tab_content"> 
        <h3>UCR's Graduation Rate Initiative</h3> 
        <br /> 
        <p>Last June, EVC/P Dallas Rabenstein appointed a task force to look into the causes of UCR's comparatively low graduation rates and to make recommendations to increase the campus's 4 and 6-year graduation rates.&nbsp; In January, the Graduation Rate Task Force submitted its final report.&nbsp; The report has been endorsed by Chancellor Kim Wilcox, EVC/P&nbsp;Rabenstein, and the College deans.</p> 
        <br />
        <br /> 
        <p>In the coming months the campus will post an implementation plan and reports on the implementation of the recommendations of the Task Force.</p> 
        <br />
        <br /> 
        <ul class="more_links"> 
         <li><a class="external" href="http://graduationrateinitiative.ucr.edu/">Visit UCR's Graduation Rate Initiative website</a></li> 
        </ul> 
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div> 
     <blockquote class="fancy_R"> 
      <p class="quote">The purpose of a university is to produce &quot;more intelligent members of society&quot; by fostering &quot;cultivation of the mind.&quot;</p> 
      <p class="quotee">John Henry Newman, *The Idea of a University*</p> 
     </blockquote>
